Caption: Figure 1: CrystalBall interface. The interface is comprised of four main views: A) Event Calendar View, B) Map View, C) Word Cloud View, and D) Social Network view. The E) Tweet panel is shown on demand.

Figure 2: System pipeline of CrystalBall: A) streaming Twitter data collection, B) named entity recognition and geocoding, C) future event identiﬁcation and ranking, and D) interactive visual interface.
Table 1: Measures of a future event

Figure 3: Examples of two events from the same day that received high and low rankings from the RankedSVM model. The top (higher- ranked) event is seen with a tightly connected social network while the bottom (lower-ranked) event has a more scattered social network.

Figure 3: Examples of two events from the same day that received high and low rankings from the RankedSVM model. The top (higher- ranked) event is seen with a tightly connected social network while the bottom (lower-ranked) event has a more scattered social network.

Figure 6: Event List view. A) The ﬂower glyph visualizes ﬁve mea- sures of the future event (LR, HR, NPMI, UD, and TS) with the num- ber of tweets in the center. B) The top bar chart shows distribution of the tweet posting time, the middle chart shows distribution of the number of tweets in 30 days, and the bottom chart shows the pre- dicted emotion values of the event. And C) Keyword summary of a future event.
Figure 4: Future events overview. A) Solid lines indicate events that share the same locations, while B) dotted lines indicate events shar- ing the same keywords.
Figure 5: Colors for emotions [11] and fuzziness for uncertainty [17].
Figure 7: A) Overview of future events in the Washington D.C. area. The ring segments indicate that there are at least 3 different events in the area. B) Clicking the cluster for detailed events.
Figure 8: Several future events detected in CrystalBall following the most violent and disruptive night of protests in Charlotte, N.C. on September 22, 2016.
Figure 9: The Word Cloud and Social Network Views indicating the upcoming curfew in Charlotte, N.C. imposed at midnight on Septem- ber 23, 2016.
Figure 12: The Occupy Wall Street event protest on September 17 is identiﬁed in the CrystalBall interface from September 11-14’s data.
Figure 11: The search result of keyword “PEGIDA”. The 2nd PEGIDA UK movement was in Birmingham, England on April 2, 2016. The 3rd PEGIDA UK march was in Rotherham on June 4, 2016.
Figure 10: A related but unexpected event for Hillary Clinton’s can- celled campaign appearance in Charlotte, N.C. following the after- math of the Charlotte protests.
Figure 13: The Women’s March on January 21, 2017 ﬁrst appeared in the CrystalBall interface on November 11, 2016.
